metadata.Title: CVE-2023-24537 on Ubuntu 20.04 LTS (focal) - medium
metadata.Description:
Calling any of the Parse functions on Go source code which contains //linedirectives with very large line numbers can cause an infinite loop due tointeger overflow.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-24537` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

golang-1.13 - 1.13.8-1ubuntu1.2
golang-1.13-go - 1.13.8-1ubuntu1.2
golang-1.13-src - 1.13.8-1ubuntu1.2
No subscription required

golang-1.16 - 1.16.2-0ubuntu1~20.04.1
golang-1.16-go - 1.16.2-0ubuntu1~20.04.1
golang-1.16-src - 1.16.2-0ubuntu1~20.04.1
No subscription required

golang-1.18 - 1.18.1-1ubuntu1~20.04.2
golang-1.18-go - 1.18.1-1ubuntu1~20.04.2
golang-1.18-src - 1.18.1-1ubuntu1~20.04.2
No subscription required

golang-1.20 - 1.20.3-1ubuntu0.1~20.04
golang-1.20-go - 1.20.3-1ubuntu0.1~20.04
golang-1.20-src - 1.20.3-1ubuntu0.1~20.04
No subscription required

criterions.comment: golang-1.13 package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.13.8-1ubuntu1.2').
golang-1.14 package in focal is affected and needs fixing.
golang-1.16 package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.16.2-0ubuntu1~20.04.1').
golang-1.18 package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.18.1-1ubuntu1~20.04.2').
golang-1.20 package in focal, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.20.3-1ubuntu0.1~20.04').
